c4

Class AlphaBetaAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • c4.ConnectFour
      • c4.AlphaBetaAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Agent, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlphaBetaTDSAgent

    public class AlphaBetaAgent
extends ConnectFour
implements Agent, java.io.Serializable
    This class is an implementation of an Alpha-Beta-Agent. It is recommended to use the implemented Methods by Agent. This Agent uses Transposition-Tables, Move-ordering, opening Books, symmetries and some other techniques to get fast results.
    Changes:
    12.12.2011: alphaBetaStartP1 and alphaBetaStartP2 look for the most distant loss. This makes the search a little bit slower, but allows a better evaluation of the td-agent
    Author:
    Markus Thill
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • randomizeLosses

        public void randomizeLosses(boolean value)
        Find the best move for the current Player in method getBestMove(). If there are equal moves, select randomly. If a board is a loss, make a almost completly random move.

      • getScore

        public double getScore(int[][] table,
              boolean useSigmoid)
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        For a given position determine the game-theoretic value, thus the outcome of the game, starting from this position. The implementation should be able to scale the score into the range -1 (Win Red) and +1 (Win Yellow) with 0 indicating a draw.
        Specified by:
        getScore in interface Agent
        Parameters:
        table - 7x6-board
        useSigmoid - put score in range -1 .. +1
        Returns:
        Score (Value) for the given board

      • semOpDown

        public void semOpDown()
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        If Threads are used, which multiply access the agents, then ensure that only one thread has mutual exclusive access. This is the DOWN-Operation on the semaphore (MUTEX). This method should be used in combination with Agent.semOpUp().
        Specified by:
        semOpDown in interface Agent

      • semOpUp

        public void semOpUp()
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        If Threads are used, which multiply access the agents, then ensure that only one thread has mutual exclusive access. This is the UP-Operation on the semaphore (MUTEX). This method should be used in combination with Agent.semOpDown().
        Specified by:
        semOpUp in interface Agent
